publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7062.1 Johann Lamont: Monitoring Poverty and Social Exclusion in Scotland 2010—As an amendment to motion (S3M-7062) in the name of John Wilson, insert at end "; notes with particular concern the finding that the child poverty rate in Scotland rose during the recession, whereas it fell in England, reversing the pattern of preceding years and that, having gone into recession in a better position on unemployment than England, this advantage has now been lost, with Scottish unemployment higher than at any point since 1996; notes with similar concern that the report identified gaps and weaknesses in the Scottish Government’s programme, and considers that this underlines the case for the swift return, at both Holyrood and Westminster, of governments that make the eradication of poverty and social exclusion a national priority." Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
